newsitem.title: USA: Tosco to test downed Bayway unit on Friday.
newsitem.headline: Tosco to test downed Bayway unit on Friday.

text.p: A downed fluid catalytic cracking unit at Tosco Corp's Bayway, New Jersey refinery will be tested Friday for a possible return to full operations, a source familiar with plant operations said.
"Oil will be put back into the unit today...it's not going to be down for a very long time," said the source.
An exact return date was not possible until tests were evaluated, the source said.
The FCC unit was put out of action on Wednesday night after a small fire at the unit's relief valve.
The cat cracker has a rated capacity of 140,000 barrels per day (bpd), one of the largest in the world. Overall distillation capacity at Bayway is 290,000 bpd.
